paper_abstract: Theoretical studies of fullerenes, metallofullerenes, and their derivatives have employed a wide spectrum of techniques, in particular graph-theoretical (like the Wiener index), quantum-chemical, and statistical-mechanical treatments, in order to evaluate and rationalize stability, reactivity, and properties of the unique cage species. The theoretical stability measures of various types are analyzed, compared and illustrated on C-80 cages satisfying the isolated-pentagon rule.
paper_title: Stabilities of fullerenes: Illustration on C-80
